intro: Arthrocereus melanurus var. estevesii, commonly known as the Estevés's night blooming cactus, is a species native to Brazil. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its columnar stem and nocturnal flowering habit. The plant produces large, fragrant, white flowers that open at night, attracting specific pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and blooming behavior, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
